RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 45. Maiden Claiming Purse 21200. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: APPEALING ROAD steadied between horses early then settled inside, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail most of the far turn, angled to the five path toward the head of the lane, closed to the lead mid-stretch and drew off the final sixteenth. ISLE BE THERE settled inside on the opening turn, gave chase from the nine sixteenths pole and raced in the three and four paths of the far turn, then dug in from the head of the lane to take second in late yards. S S FRONTIER ANGEL raced with the pace inside and dueled from the seven sixteenths pole, contested even terms nearest the rail on the far turn but flattened the final sixteenth. AWESOME MOON raced with the then dueled leaving the seven sixteenths pole, contested even terms two deep on the far turn then flattened the final sixteenth. AFLEET PENGUIN rounded the first turn about the five path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. LOCKDOWN VANNA raced well back inside on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the five sixteenths pole then rounded the far turn about the six path. WISHING FOR SPRING saved ground on the first turn then steadied at the rail at the half mile pole and showed little response through the backstretch. SHOWTHEMONEYHONEY raced off the pace in the three path the opening turn then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: S S Frontier Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace inside,dueled 7/16,even terms rail turn,flattened 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAD GENIUS took the lead two deep into the first turn and rated clear from the nine sixteenths pole, came pressure toward the five sixteenths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. TAPIT TO THE WIRE rated close to the earlier pace in the three and four paths, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, contested at a disadvantage two deep through the far turn and proved no match in the lane while dueling for second. FIVE STAR PHIL rounded the opening turn in the five path then stalked from the half mile pole, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then relented second in the duel through the stretch. URBAN WARRIOR settled close off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole and raced near the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn but flattened the final sixteenth. SCINTILLIO raced with the early pace inside, gave chase leaving the half mile pole but faded in the three path of the far turn. INGREIDO saved ground off the pace then bid only mildly approaching the five sixteenths pole. UNIMPEACHED rated close inside on the first turn but showed little response through the backstretch. EARTHQUAKEDIRECTOR was not a factor. WORLD OF FOOLS raced off the pace in the five path on the first turn and was never a factor. LUNAR IMAGE lost contact early.

ENTRY.NAME: Unimpeached
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

ENTRY.NAME: Urban Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: close off rail,chased 1/2,rail far turn,eased out 1/8,flattened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 82. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 23000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE JANUARY 21, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 21 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COACH RUBE chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn, took the lead inside the eighth pole and dueled clear mid-stretch. COLLEGE KID was hustled to the lead at the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, drifted a path leaving the turn, gave the nod to the winner past the eighth pole and just lasted for second. TIZ THE REASON chased and raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn, dug in through the lane and just missed second. LIME AFTER LIME gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and finished well. THUNDER PUNCH gave chase, rounded the turn at the rail and ran evenly to late stretch before flattening stride. DISTORTED SPLENDOR gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path of the turn and showed little in the lane. VICTORY ROYALE chased the pace then flattened at the rail on the turn. AT THE HALF broke a step slow and rounded the turn in the three and four paths.

ENTRY.NAME: College Kid
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled up,set pressured pace,edge rail turn,yield,held 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Starter Allowance Purse 23000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE JANUARY 21, 2021. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 21 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DULCIMER DAME stalked three wide, took aim nearing the five sixteenths pole and contested the far turn two deep, moved to the lead approaching the head of the lane, raced clear past the eighth pole and was mildly hand urged in the lane. BETCHA BY GOLLY stalked off the rail the first turn, took over at the half mile pole and came under pressure leaving the three eighths, contested the edge nearest the rail most of the far turn, but was met toward the head of the lane and ceded leaving the eighth pole. DIVINE FASHION rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased out toward the head of the lane but showed little further. MY JUBA saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and finished evenly to improve her position. CHINA CAT became a bit fractious in the gate then hesitated at the break, saved ground racing well back from contention, improved in the four path of the far turn, left the turn outside and finished evenly. TARGE was not a factor. HIDDEN IDENTITY rounded the first turn in the four path then stalked leaving the turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole but flattened while losing ground on the far turn. VALID REASON set the pace inside, was met leaving the first turn, gave chase through the backstretch then faded at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Valid Reason
ENTRY.COMMENT: early pace inside,met 1/2,chased,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: My Juba
ENTRY.OWNER: Lugamo Racing Stable LLC and J R Sanchez Racing Stable

ENTRY.NAME: China Cat
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit fractious gate,hesitated break,saved ground,4p turn,even fnsh

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 16900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JULY 21, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since July 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lb s. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PLATINUM FROLIC rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in under steady encouragement to hold on. TIZ MICHELLE'S WAY stalked from the three path the first turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path, dueled through the stretch to take second late yards and was gaining on the winner. CLEARLY VISIBLE saved ground off the pace, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, eased out leaving the turn then outfinished in the duel through the stretch. MARKETABILITY raced well back in the three path the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the five path and ran evenly in the stretch. MS. MALEVOLENCE saved ground well off the pace, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. RAVIOLI MAMA settled back in the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path, eased outward through the upper stretch and finished evenly outside. MISS WAVE stalked inside, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn then weakened. SKYFLY saved ground. LADY KAZA stalked off the rail on the opening turn then faded through the backstretch. MAE SAI PRINCESS became very fractious, flipped in the gate and raced well back.

ENTRY.NAME: Platinum Frolic
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,dug in lane,held on

ENTRY.NAME: Clearly Visible
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,rail far turn,outfinished stretch duel

ENTRY.NAME: Mae Sai Princess
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious, flipped in gate,raced well back

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MI GUSTO ES was hustled to the front approaching the seven sixteenths pole, dug in at the rail on the turn and drew off under steady stretch encouragement. LION OF THE SEA chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path of the turn and cleared second nearing the sixteenth pole. BELMULLET gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail then dueled through the stretch for second. SAAFEN broke awkwardly and steadied on the chute, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the five path, left the turn outside and finished well. JOHNNY SWISH chased, raced in the three path of the turn then flattened stride. D TACHYON chased inside leaving the half mile pole, raced at the rail on the turn, left the turn off the heels of Wayne's Hope, eased out past the eighth pole and finished evenly. FOREST FROST pressured the pace and raced close off the rail on the turn, then weakened inside the eighth pole. AMERICAN ROCKY was not a factor. LOVED AGAIN chased outside, raced in the six path of the turn and weakened in the lane. WAYNE'S HOPE chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: D Tachyon
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,blocked into lane,eased out,even lane

ENTRY.NAME: Mi Gusto Es
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to front,rail turn,steady urging lane,drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Wayne's Hope
ENTRY.OWNER: Gilbert Melissa Rentz and Oxendine Martin

ENTRY.NAME: Forest Frost
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,close off rail turn,weakened inside 1/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Dece mber 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 21 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STORM BOARDER (CHI) first chased then contested the pace nearing the three eighths pole, dueled clear midway on the turn and was steadily encouraged to widen in the lane. GOLDEN G chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail then dug in to clear second later yards. MR TINGLES led early then contested the pace from the three eighths pole, dropped back midway on the turn, drifted into the lane and flattened the final sixteenth. NOVA BOY raced well back from early contention, rounded the turn in the three path, moved to the outside into the lane and finished well; widest. HEY CONGRATS gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the five path then flattened. NITRO TIME chased, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. STEVETHEVANDRIVER gave chase then flattened in the three path of the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Boarder (CHI)
ENTRY.COMMENT: contested pace inside,dueled clear mid turn,widened driving

ENTRY.NAME: Golden G
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,rail turn,dug in lane,cleared 2nd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 13300. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWEET VALERIA rounded the opening turn in the five path then stalked into the backstretch, started her bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole, raced close four wide on the far turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and edged clear late yards. WHY LEA rounded the first turn about the three path, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole and raced five wide on the far turn, dug in from the eighth pole and took second the final strides. CAN'T FIGURE settled close in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the three path, left the turn on the heels of NOBLE PRESENT, eased out from that point and briefly occupied second place, but flattened in the final yards, while the latter stalked off the rail, gave chase from the three eighths pole and contested even terms two deep on the far turn and remained a close factor to mid-stretch before flattening stride. OUR GOLDEN COLLEEN rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, contested even terms at the rail on the far turn, was met mid-stretch and flattened stride. MANGORITA raced well off the early pace about the four path, left the turn outside and picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and ran evenly in the lane. KOKOLORES raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. LICENSE TO CARRY saved early ground and showed little response through the backstretch. BODIE'S STORM rounded the opening turn in the four path and showed little response. AMERICAN LEGACY was through after three eighths.

ENTRY.NAME: Mangorita
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 4p,outside 1/2,chased 7/16,3p far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Our Golden Colleen
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,even terms rail turn,flatten 1/16
